text: this woman had a simple idea for her
street closed early road cars for a
couple of hours at a time so that we
could give over the space to children
our children were not getting outside
enough they were not physically active
enough we saw that we had this great
space immediately outside their front
doors but they couldn't use it this
isn't a one-off street party this street
and bristol plays together every Tuesday
it means kids spend less time trapped
indoors and adults can make friends with
neighbors Alice thinks it's an easy
cheap way to tackle childhood obesity
and social isolation it's really brought
our community together it's really good
because we've made lots of friends at
the street they can look back and have
some of what I had because I always
played out but obviously times have
changed scientists have studied these
schemes you can get an extra 10 minutes
of moderate to vigorous physical
activity just from simple closure of a
street for a short period of time
government guidelines say children
should get 60 minutes of exercise per
day an experiment in Ghent Belgium
compared 19 play streets with normal
streets for eight days fitting children
with sensors each session lasted five
hours and the council even provided a
box of toys it found children in play
streets did about 15 minutes more
moderate to vigorous exercise each day
in Bristol it was one simple change that
allowed this idea to thrive instead of
having to fill out multiple forms now
streets apply just once to hold regular
sessions eight years on more than 40 UK
authorities used the same system
inspired Toronto is the latest City to
pilot the scheme it's all about getting
kids outside playing again and it was a
natural part of my childhood but it's a
big piece of childhood that's missing
from the modern day
[Music]
